name: houndstooth crochet beanie
notes:
the **houndstooth crochet beanie** is a timeless and stylish accessory perfect for everyone! with its beautifully simple yet eye-catching pattern, this classic hat brings a touch of elegance and warmth to any wardrobe. the houndstooth stitch (basic single and double crochet stitches) creates a striking, textured design that looks intricate but is surprisingly easy to make.

we'll start by crocheting the brim in rows, then join the ribbing to begin working the houndstooth pattern in the round, alternating colors every other round. to keep things simple, the yarn will be carried along, minimizing the number of ends to weave in.

whether you’re crocheting it for yourself or as a thoughtful handmade gift, this beanie is a cozy, versatile staple that’s sure to become a favorite for chilly days! 

crochet hook:
[g (4.0mm) & g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][1]

notions:
[removable stitch marker][2]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][3]
[scissors][4]

yarn:
[mary maxim mellowspun][5]
100% acrylic, 284yds/100g

yardage:
color a: pink (plum, denim) (spruce, nutmeg, black)
70 (130, 150) (165, 180, 200) yds
for fold-up brim - 1 ball each size (less for regular brim)

color b: white
25 (30, 40) (50, 60, 70) yds
1 ball each size

yarn substitutions:
[premier colorfusion dk yarn][6]
100% acrylic, 325yds/100g

[mary maxim prism][7]
100% acrylic, 290yds/100g

[wecrochet swish dk][8]
100% fine superwash merino wool 110yds/50g

[herrschners sweet swirls yarn][9]
100% acrylic, 612yds/200g

[willow yarns daily dk][10]
100% superwash wool, 284yds/100g

abbreviations:
blo - back loop only
ch(s) - chain(s)
dc - double crochet
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sc3tog -single crochet three together
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

gauge:
15 sts and 14 rows = 4" by 4"  in stitch pattern repeat (see gauge swatch instructions), not blocked.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][11]

sizes:
newborn (baby, toddler) (child, adult, large adult)

skill level:
advanced beginner
